block.p: TENNECO AUTOMOTIVE INC., -- Lake Forest, Ill., the largest maker of exhaust systems in the world, said it had agreed to work with the Futaba Industrial Co. of Japan, to produce mufflers and related parts for automakers in Japan.

DUKE ENERGY CORP., -- Charlotte, N.C., one of the biggest electricity, natural gas and energy-trading companies in the United States, said it planned to upgrade three California power plants to add generation in a state that is facing electricity shortages. Terms were not disclosed.

E.I. DU PONT DE NEMOURS & CO. CORP., -- Wilmington, Del., a global chemical and life sciences company, said it would combine its apparel, home textiles and related business into a new unit called DuPont Apparel and Textile Sciences.

POORE BROTHERS INC., -- Goodyear, Ariz., which makes, markets and distributes salted snack foods, temporarily shut down production at its home plant because of a fire over the weekend that damaged the roof and equipment over the potato chip processing area.
